com.backend

Class MySQLMethods

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.backend.MySQLMethods

  • public class MySQLMethods
extends java.lang.Object
    This Class will hold all the methods to allow manipulation of the Data in the Database. This uses MySQL to actively store and edit data.

    • Method Detail

      • createDatabase

        public static void createDatabase()
        This method runs at the start of any Query. It checks if the database has already been created and, if it hasn't, creates it.

      • createTable

        public static void createTable()
        This method creates the main table which would store studentData information and current hours.

      • createStudentTable

        public static void createStudentTable(java.lang.String firstName,
                                      java.lang.String lastName,
                                      int studentID)
        This method creates a specific studentData table. This would allow more specific storage of data, such as data of specific events and such and make it much easier to analyze a students data.
        Parameters:
        firstName - This is the studentData's First Name
        lastName - This is the studentData's Last Name
        studentID - The Student's Student ID Number

      • createStudent

        public static void createStudent(java.lang.String firstName,
                                 java.lang.String lastName,
                                 int studentID,
                                 short grade,
                                 double communityServiceHours,
                                 java.lang.String communityServiceCategory,
                                 java.lang.String email,
                                 short yearsDone)
        This method makes it very easy to create a studentData in the main tracker table.
        Parameters:
        firstName - The First Name of the Student
        lastName - The Last Name of the Student
        studentID - The Student's Student ID Number
        grade - The Student's Grade Number
        communityServiceHours - The Number of Community Service Hours completed by the studentData
        communityServiceCategory - The Category of Award Aimed for by the Student
        email - The Student's Email Address
        yearsDone - The number of years of FBLA Completed

      • addStudentHours

        public static void addStudentHours(java.lang.String firstName,
                                   java.lang.String lastName,
                                   int studentID,
                                   java.lang.String eventName,
                                   double hours,
                                   int year,
                                   int month,
                                   int day)
                            throws java.lang.Exception
        This adds events and hours into a students unique table. At the same time, this updates the hours in the main table
        Parameters:
        firstName - The First Name of the Student
        lastName - The Last Name of the Student
        studentID - The Student's Student ID Number
        eventName - The Name of the Event Completed
        hours - The Length of the Event
        year - The Year the Event Was Done
        month - The Month of the Event
        day - The Day of the Event
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - This is throws in case the Database is not found

      • changeName

        @Deprecated
public static java.lang.String changeName(java.lang.String nameIn)
        Deprecated. changeName(String, String)
        This method is used to change the name of a studentData to a more useful and easier to use format.
        Parameters:
        nameIn - the input name, which should only consist of first name and last name
        Returns:
        Name in the Format first_last

      • changeName

        public static java.lang.String changeName(java.lang.String firstName,
                                          java.lang.String lastName)
        This turns a name into the format first_last for more uses in a database and to allow for more consistency.
        Parameters:
        firstName - the studentData's first name
        lastName - the studentData's last name
        Returns:
        the String containing the new name

      • makeName

        public static java.lang.String makeName(java.lang.String firstName,
                                        java.lang.String lastName,
                                        int studentID)
        This method would be used to make studentData table names in MySQL (firstName_lastName_studentID)
        Parameters:
        firstName - First Name
        lastName - Last Name
        studentID - Student ID
        Returns:
        formatted Name

      • numberOfRows

        public static int numberOfRows(java.lang.String tableName)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns the number of rows in a table. This is extremely useful in knowing the number of times to loop a certain event.
        Parameters:
        tableName - the name of the table being counted
        Returns:
        the number of rows
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - for SQL Errors
